intro: Trachoma papuanum, commonly known as the Papuan trachoma, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or white. The plant has compound leaves with small leaflets and produces pods that contain seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
